meanings.def: having a low rank in an organization or a profession
examples: junior to somebody She is junior to me.
She's quite junior in the organization.

meanings.def: connected with young people below a particular age, rather than with adults, especially in sports
examples: He's a member of the club's junior team.

meanings.def: (especially in the US) used after the name of a man who has the same name as his father, to make it clear who is being referred to
for children under the age of 11 or 13
connected with the year before the last year in a high school or college
examples: I spent my junior year in France.

meanings.def: a young person below a particular age, rather than an adult
examples: She has coached many of our leading juniors.
At 16, he’s still eligible to play for the juniors.

meanings.def: a child who goes to junior school
examples: Sam is going to be a junior next year.

meanings.def: a student in the year before the last year at high school or college
a person who has a job at a low level within an organization

examples: I leave junior with Mom when I'm at work.

meanings.def: to be younger than somebody, by the number of years mentioned
examples: She's his junior by four years.

idioms.idiom: be… years somebody’s junior | be somebody’s junior (by…)
idioms.def: to be younger than somebody, by the number of years mentioned
examples: She's his junior by four years.
